content:
Ruleset:
Framework stolen from Desperado, who stole it from BBMolla, who stole it from Tierce, who stole it from Magua. It has a good lineage.

General:
Site-wide rules apply at all times.
Have fun.
Play to win.
Do not edit or delete your posts. If you encounter a problem, bold a request for me to fix it and I will.
Do not quote communications outside the game thread (role PMs, quicktopics, etc.) in the game thread. Paraphrasing is allowed. If in doubt, ask.
Do not use cryptography, invisible text, tiny text, or any other form of text manipulation.
Do not use any form of provable randomness. Claiming to use dice and voting accordingly is acceptable—publically throwing the dice is not.
Do not impersonate the moderator. Orange is reserved for me. I will not lie to you.
Pretending to break a rule is the same thing as breaking a rule.
No personal attacks, no insults, no making fun of diseases/conditions/handicaps. Swearing is cool, calling someone “fucking autistic” is not.
Breaking any of these rules will result in a warning, forcible replacement, or modkill, depending on the severity and context of the infraction.
I reserve the right to change the rules. I will notify you in thread if this is necessary.

Activity:
If a player goes 48 hours without posting, I will prod them. Prods will be announced in thread.
If a player does not respond to the prod within 24 hours, receives multiple prods during the same game day, or is prodded three times overall, they will be forcibly replaced.
If you will be V/LA for any period of time, simply alert me in thread via bold text.
Each game day will have a deadline of 14 days.
Deadlines will never fall on a weekend.
In the event that the deadline hits before a lynch is reached, a no lynch will occur.
Each night will have a deadline of 48 hours.
If a player has a night action and does not submit their action before the deadline, they will perform no action.
I may extend deadlines at my discretion, and will alert you in thread should this be necessary.

Voting:
Votes should be at the beginning of a new line and bolded or voted, in the format of VOTE: Formerfish or VOTE: Formerfish
Abbreviations, missing punctuation, and misspellings will be accepted as long as I can deduce your meaning.
Unvoting is not necessary.
Once a majority decision is reached, it is final.
You may post during twilight until I officially lock the thread.
When you are dead, that’s it. No bah posts.

At least one player in the game will receive the following Role PM
Welcome, Formerfish! You are a Vanilla Townie!

You may not act at night, so your activity and your vote are your only means of achieving victory.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.

Confirm your role and alignment via PM. The game thread is located [url]here[/url]. Good luck!
Role PMs are going out now, the game will start once 7/12 have confirmed their role in a PM to the Mod.

Welcome one and all to the hunt to end all hunts. Before you, stand 12 brave souls who are willing to put life and limb on the line to defend their people. Gathered here we have people from all walks of life, their loyalties are unknown to each other, but can be powerful when they work together. Some of those people want to see nothing more than the death and destruction of the town. Everyone involved will use their powers of deduction, manipulation, and whatever gifts the Gods have given them to expose each other and cause the death of those who oppose them. Prepare yourselves for the ultimate hunt, each other. Let the games begin.

2. bjc*- Survived, Vanilla Townie
9. Boonskiies*- Survived Vanilla Townie

(A * next to a players name indicates that a prod has been given out)

Dead Players:
Spoiler:
4. OkaPoka- lynched day 1, Vanilla Townie
7. Shinobi- killed night 1, Town 2-shot Hider
12. shinyskarmory- killed night 1, Vanilla Townie
8. massive- lynched day 2, One-shot Bulletproof Serial Killer, Third-Party
10. Grib- killed night 2, Town Doublevoter
6. Octopus Nul*- lynched day 3, Town Jack of All Trades
11. Fat_Tony* KittyMo- killed night 3, Vanilla Townie
3. Tattletale I Love Fairies- lynched day 4, Mafia Goon
1. theelkspeaks**- killed night 4, Town 3-shot Neighborizer
5. Drew-Sta- lynched day 5, Mafia Goon


You have all signed up knowing that it is possible you won’t make it to the end alive. Use everything you have at your disposal to survive.

Day starts now

With 12 alive, it takes 7 to lynch.
(expired on 2014-07-03 00:22:00)

So we meet again.

> watching who DOESN'T vote
> learning who future dead people voted for, be they town or scum

As the sun begins to set on the second day of conflict the town members take little solace in the fact that they have taken out one threat, knowing that more are still out there among them, hiding in plain sight. Of their original numbers, only eight remain. One town member breaks away from the rest of the group as darkness overtakes them, finding a need to be alone with his thoughts.

The man goes back to the warehouse and stands over the bloodstained floor, looking for any clue he could find that would help him in his search for those who wish harm to him, and his people. Looking over every inch of the space before dejectedly giving up, he finally goes on his way. Stopping in the alley for a moment to think about the other fallen town member he kneels down for a time saying a prayer under his breath. Suddenly a feeling arises in him and the buildings begin to close in on him, the residual heat from the streets becomes oppressive and breathing becomes more and more labored. Not knowing what to do, he looks around in a panic. Finally he spots something that he believes might help on multiple fronts. Across town he sees a building that towers over the rest of the metropolis, dwarfing any other building around it.

Gradually making his way to his respite he thinks to himself that the building would be perfect for him to escape from the stifling streets, to get some fresh air, and to have a good vantage point to look over the city. As he is walking he hears a sound behind him, something that almost sounds like the scrape of a boot on the pavement. Turning around he sees nothing, and in the time he waits nothing presents itself to him. Straining his eyes in the dark to see, he convinces himself that he is just wound tightly, and there are no boogey men in the dark waiting for him and he moves on. Finally he reaches the building and makes his way to the top.

The view from the rooftop was stunning, and he was able to see for miles in each direction. He saw the warehouse, the alley and the area where the town members gathered during the day. Something begins to eat at him but he cannot pin it down. Circling around the edges of an idea he paces back and forth nearer to the edge than he realizes. A gust of wind blows hard and knocks him off balance. Stumbling, flailing his arms, he envisions his end coming from a simple gust of wind. However, he digs his heel into the gravel of the roof and finds purchase there. That was a close one, he thought.

Unfortunately for him during the ruckus he failed to see the man in black slip out of the stairwell, and into the shadows. The man in black had been following him all night, keeping a good distance, well outside the man’s realm of observation. Once after they visited the alley he thought that he was caught when he miss-stepped and scraped his boot on the raised gutter. His heart had skipped many beats in the time he stood silent and stoic, waiting for the other man to resume his journey. His patience was well rewarded, getting the town member separated and completely alone. He watched as the other man stood on the edge of the roof, looking down at what could have easily been the fall that killed him. Without a sound the man in black crept up behind him, took hold of his collar and his belt, whispered something into his ear before throwing him clear over the edge. The man flipped over in the air and you could see the distress on his face, the last thing that ran through his mind before hitting the roof of the car below, blowing out all of the windows in a shower of glass, was “I didn’t even know she had a brother.”

As another day is put to rest the town reflects on the lynching of one of their own. The men and women look at the faces left and wonder who among them really are to blame for the most recent loss. As their numbers dwindle the situation at hand becomes more and more dire, and scum needs to be found soon for the sake of the town. As the group begins to disperse and go to ground for another night Fat_Tony thinks that he sees a smile on one of the other group members faces. Confused by what he saw, Tony decides to follow the smiling player to see where they go, who knows maybe he will get lucky and find something out.

Smiley walks off down an alley with Tony in close pursuit. Tony makes sure to stay to the shadows, using doorways to shield himself from view, and windows to get a better view while avoiding detection. Smiley doesn’t make things easy for Tony, multiple times he stops to light a cigarette, only to take a few drags off it look around and snuff the cigarette out beneath his shoe. Smiley used every move in the book to avoid detection. Doubling back on himself, stopping in front of shop windows to watch the people as they pass, walking against Don’t Walk signals. Tony knew that he had made the right choice to follow Smiley, for whatever reason he did not want anyone to know where he was going.

It felt like Tony had been following Smiley much longer than he actually had when Smiley turned a corner and was out of his sight for only a few seconds. Tony sped up to avoid losing his prey in the sea of people on the streets. Turning the bend Tony realized too late that this was exactly what Smiley was hoping for. Smiley had picked up the tail sometime before and was luring the man pursuing him closer and closer. The shocked look on Tony’s face was only changed by the punch thrown by Smiley that solidly connected with his chin. Seeing stars Tony could barely make out Smiley as they ran down the street. Taking every ounce of strength he had in him Tony rose to his feet and gave chase.

Tearing down the streets both of our players banged into pedestrians, knocking some to the ground, bouncing off others as they went. Tony ran with everything he had in him using the knowledge that if he lost sight of Smiley they would be in the wind for sure. Veering off of the sidewalk Tony jumped onto the hood of a car parked on the street and started to run on the hoods and roofs, gaining ground as he went. Smiley looked back and saw that Tony was quickly catching up to him, and ducked down the next alley that he came across. Tony followed him and saw that Smiley had turned into the first open door down the alley. Without a second thought Tony breached the doorway and found himself in the middle of a bustling kitchen filled with Chinese men, live chickens, smoke and open flames. The cooks were yelling in tongues that Tony could not understand, but he grasped the fact that they were yelling at Smiley who had just passed through into the dining room. Tony barreled through the men, catching hell from them as well, and entered the dining room. Smiley was there throwing tables out of his way as he moved towards the door. Running full speed out of the restaurant into the street Smiley ran right into traffic, jumping and sliding across the hood of a car that almost certainly would have ended his days. Tony had no second thoughts as he dodged the stopped vehicles keeping Smiley in his sights the entire time.

Smiley ran down the alley in front of him, jumping onto a dumpster and launching himself into the air to grab hold of the raised ladder of the building’s fire escape. Using his weight Smiley was able to lower the ladder enough for him to climb onto the ladders rung and began climbing. Tony jumped onto the same dumpster and used the drain pipe on the wall to reach the fire escape. Only a flight behind Smiley, Tony redoubled his efforts taking the rungs two and three at a time. Smiley ducked into an open window and ran past a family at their dining room table eating a late supper. The family stopped in midsentence and stared at the commotion that interrupted their meal. A few seconds later Tony went by and the family had not moved, still staring in disbelief. Smiley was already at the fire door for the stairs and pushed the bar setting off a blare of lights and alarms. The door shut behind him and Tony knew that he would have to be more careful when approaching the door thinking that Smiley could be on the other side waiting for him to slip up again. Standing in front of the door Tony waited a second, and then one more before backing up to the wall behind him, dug his heel in and kicked the push bar as hard as he could. The door shot open revealing an open stair well. Tony looked over the railing and could see Smiley three flights below him. Jumping down entire half flights of stairs Tony made his way after his foe.

When he got to street level and out the exit Tony did not immediately see his object of pursuit. Looking left he saw no sign of Smiley, looking right he caught a glimpse of the back of Smiley’s head as they ran down the entrance of the subway system. Tearing after them, Tony ran full speed into the subway tunnels. Tony was sure that he had Smiley cornered now and made his way to the platform where Smiley was assured to be. Tony looked over the platform and could not make out his quarry. Tony went to the edge of the inbound tracks and looked into the tunnel to see if Smiley had jumped onto the tracks trying to escape into the depths of the underground transit infrastructure. Seeing no signs of movement Tony went to the outbound side of the platform and looked to the left, and saw nothing. Looking to the right he only saw the lights of the oncoming subway car. Feeling dejected and confused Tony began to turn back towards the platform when he felt two hands firmly push him in the back. Before Tony could even register what had happened he became aware of the increasing glare of the lights from the subway car. Tony only had seconds to consider Smiley had somehow gotten behind him and caused this all to happen. Seconds slowed to a crawl and Tony saw his impending death with a Zen like clarity, seeing the light get brighter and closer to him before slamming into him, throwing him into the wall and crushing his skull beneath the train wheels and the rails. His death came so quickly that he was gone before the first scream was heard, and the person who caused it was not suspected in the least and was able to blend in with the crowd as they made their way steadily to the exit.

For those still alive, the past few days and night have been hell on earth. Infighting, deceit, paranoia, murder and revenge have ravaged the town until it became a shell of its former self. Few temporary moments of happiness among the pain have allowed those who are left to find the strength to carry on and finish the job they set out to do, find fucking scum. Going into the night four players remain. Theelkspeaks, bjc, Drew-Sta, and Boonskiies are still alive and kicking.

As the day comes to a close the four remaining players sit around a blazing bonfire, remembering those they lost, drinking in their names, and cursing those who took the ones they cared about away. Names like massive and Tattletale are spoken with an obvious disdain, like being spit out when said. Knowing that there was one more scumbag between them left an uneasy tension hanging thick in the air. Most of them wondered if they would all be there come morning, one player knew that would not be the case. The final toasts were made, lingering goodbyes were said, and the players finally broke apart and went their separate ways.

Theelkspeaks felt restless and chose to walk around the city to put his mind at ease. Walking down bustling streets feeling like he was completely separated from any of them, he tried to imagine how it what it must be like to be one of the uninformed. Ignorance truly is bliss, and if the people around him knew what was really going on in their city they would curl up in their beds and pray for the end. Families, couples, dirtbag teens loitering in convenience store parking lots, joggers, barflies all of them oblivious to the violence that was about to erupt in the streets.

Elk felt an electricity flowing through the air that threatened to light the night aflame. Glancing around Elk saw nothing noticeably out of order, and he continued on his way. When Elk started walking again he saw a reflection in the window of one a parked car of a man slipping out of a dark doorway, following him at a distance. Adrenaline pumped into Elks system, heightening his senses, putting a quicker step into his pace. It would have been unnoticeable a minute prior, but now Elk was able to hear the safety being taken off of a pistol. Elk took one more step before ducking behind the bumper of a mini van parked in the row of cars. As soon as he had ducked down a shot rang out, and the side mirror of the car behind him exploded.

Elk knew this was his time. One of them was going to die and fuck if it was going to be him. Elk drew his own handgun, a Shield M&P, from the small of his back. The .40 caliber weapon held eight shots including one in the chamber, which should be enough for any trained owner. Elk took the safety off his own weapon, pulled back the slide to see the gun was fully loaded, peered around the back of the vehicle and took a shot in the direction he had last seen the mystery man. One. Hearing the shot ricochet off the brick wall of the closest building he knew that he did not connect with anything. Elk let himself linger for a second franticly looking for his query without any luck. Taking cover just in time another shot was taken at him, hitting the body of the van he was behind. Lowering himself into a laying postion in the street, looking from under the van Elk pulled the trigger twice more trying to flush the other man out. Two, three. Not seeing any movement Elk took off running towards the now abandoned convenience store, hoping to find better cover there. Pointing the pistol behind him as he ran he fired another shot blindly. Four. Running for his life Elk quickly covered the distance to the open door of the store. As he entered more shots rang out and the plate glass panel of the door shattered behind him. Elk quickly took stock of his surroundings. Coolers on the left, cash register on the right, fire exit in the back. Crawling he made his was out of sight from the outside of the store and went to the fire exit. Chained. Fucking great. Looking behind him he knew that going back out the front was not an option, and without any other windows he had to make due with the door in front of him. Elk took aim and fired twice, breaking the lock of the chain. Five, six. Kicking open the door into the alley he heard more gunfire from the front of the store. Elk wish he knew what the other man was carrying, so that he had a better idea of how many shots he had left to worry about.

Elk tore down the alley trying any door that he could. All of them were locked. Running further into the alley he worried that maybe this was his time to die after all. A bang echoed off the walls and something screamed past him clanging off a dumpster just ahead of him. Elk dropped into a roll and took cover, firing off a quick shot in response. Seven. Elk heard the other man cry out in pain. Elk slowly made his way back toward the other man finding him on the ground clutching his shoulder. Elk trained his weapon on the man before him and said, “Move one fucking muscle and I will fucking end you right here, right now.” The wounded man looked into Elks eyes trying to get a read on him. Seeing a glimpse of what he could only consider weakness the downed man raised his weapon. Without a second thought Elk pulled the trigger on his Shield. Click. Confused, Elk pulled the trigger again. Click. Click. Click. Nothing. Elks mind was racing as he tried to recount his shots. He had fired seven right? He should have one more bullet left. Did his gun malfunction, or did he fail to load all eight shells into the weapon? In the seconds that it took to run though everything, the other man pointed his weapon at Elk pulling the trigger without hesitation. Elk heard the bang, and then the lights went out.
